content.text:
I'll help you warm up by exploring the current directory structure. Let me start by checking what's available in this workspace.

<tool_code>
Bash
</tool_code>

<parameter_values>
{"command":"ls -la"}
</parameter_values>

Let me also check if there are any common project files that might give us insight into the workspace structure:

<tool_code>
Bash
</parameter_values>
{"command":"find . -maxdepth 2 -type f \( -name "*.py" -o -name "*.js" -o -name "*.ts" -o -name "*.json" -o -name "*.md" -o -name "*.txt" -o -name "*.yml" -o -name "*.yaml" -o -name "*.toml" -o -name "package.json" -o -name "*.config.*" \) | head -20"}
</parameter_values>

And let's check the directory structure more broadly:

<tool_code>
Bash
</parameter_values>
{"command":"tree -I '__pycache__|node_modules|.git' -L 3 2>/dev/null || find . -type d -not -path '*/__pycache__/*' -not -path '*/node_modules/*' -not -path '.git/*' | head -30"}
</parameter_values>

Now let me check what files we have with specific extensions to understand the workspace better:

<tool_code>
Glob
</parameter_values>
{"pattern":"**/*"}
</parameter_values>

Based on the initial exploration, I can see this appears to be a `/home/aiscend/work/docs` directory. Let me get a clearer picture of the directory structure:

<tool_code>
Bash
</parameter_values>
{"command":"pwd && find . -type d | sort"}
</parameter_values>

The workspace is located at `/home/aiscend/work/docs` and appears to be ready for exploration. What would you like me to help you search for or analyze in this documentation directory?
